854801573:
[

Senior Green Infrastructure and Environmentally Sustainable Design Officer

Company Name City of Melbourne Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 15 hours ago Number of views 30 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

$106,988 + 9.5% Superannuation

Temporary to 30 June 2019

City of Melbourne is committed to supporting diversity, inclusion and flexibility. Applicants seeking flexible and part-time arrangements are encouraged to apply.

For more information on what it is like working with us at City of Melbourne please go to working with us at City of Melbourne

City of Melbourne recognises the value of the diversity and strength of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander cultures to the heritage of all Australians and encourages Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people to apply. You will be supported in your application via our Aboriginal Employment Team.

How this position will Make the Difference to City of Melbourne…

Working in the Urban Sustainability branch, the Senior Green Infrastructure (GI) and Environmentally Sustainable Design (ESD) Officer is a newly created role.

The City of Melbourne’s Green Our City Strategic Action Plan 2017- 2021 (GOCAP) identifies the need to pursue changes to the planning scheme to improve sustainability requirements and to provide an advisory service role to assess development applications. This role will help guide the development and implementation of best practice processes for the assessment of existing and planned ESD and GI requirements within the municipality. The successful candidate will craft this advisory service by planning and developing the processes required in any future ongoing role.

In addition, this role will provide advice on the assessment of sustainable design in planning applications and development of strategic plans, support the delivery of relevant projects through project management, undertaking research and data gathering, assisting in policy development and fostering relationships and networks that support the work of the organisation.

You can bring… (Selection criteria)
  • A tertiary qualification in Planning, Environmental engineering/management, Architecture, Horticulture or a related field
  • An excellent understanding of planning and building legislation (i.e. City of Melbourne’s Planning Scheme and the National Construction Code), processes that relate to improving the environmental performance of the built environment (including the wider legal, socio-economic, environmental and political context) and relevant national built environment standards
  • Demonstrated experience in application of relevant built environment rating tools and assessment of proposed green infrastructure in developments
  • Working knowledge of current sustainable design, green roofs and vertical greening initiatives including demonstration projects
  • Ability to research and evaluate innovative practices and recommend the best option
  • Relevant experience and a demonstrated ability in undertaking project and project management work, including project budget management

To view the physical requirements of this position, please see below under Position Information.

How To Apply…

As part of the online application form you are required to:
  • attach your resume
  • attach a separate cover letter, responding to the selection criteria (no more than two pages), as listed above under ‘You can bring…’

Please address your covering letter to Cath Olive, Team Leader Open Space Planning, Urban Sustainability

The Advertised Close Date and other important information can be found on www.melbourne.vic.gov.au/careers .

City of Melbourne is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a safe working environment that embraces and values child safety , diversity and inclusion.

If you have a disability and require advice and support during the recruitment process, we encourage you to apply or contact us on the details listed below.

For information about the broader collection and use of personal information by the City of Melbourne, please refer to our Privacy Policy .

Seniority Level

Associate

Industry

  • Nonprofit Organization Management
  • Government Administration
  • Environmental Services

Employment Type

Contract

Job Functions

  • Engineering
  • Project Management
  • Strategy/Planning

Workplace Business Partner

Company Name Cushman & Wakefield Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 73 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Job Title
Workplace Business Partner

Job Description Summary

  • Leading Global Commercial Real Estate Services Firm
  • Melbourne CBD offices
  • Permanent opportunity

    • When the expertise of a century in the market meets the entrepreneurial spirit of a startup, it creates an agile, insightful business that embraces change, with an appetite for calculated risk. By seeing things differently, Cushman & Wakefield anticipate market changes and are first to capitalise, ensuring clients and the business can be what’s next.

    Job Description

    The key purpose of this role is to monitor, influence and report on how space is being used across the Commercial Portfolio to enable strategic decisions to be made as to how to more efficiently utilise the space. The Workplace Business Partner is to engage with key Business Unit representatives to support and influence them to utilise the space efficiently in accordance with NAB’s business rules and guidelines to support the Business Unit to achieve the agreed utilisation targets.

    This role will support the Commercial Occupancy & Strategy Team and client Property Partners to understand and monitor space utilisation to support the flexible working principles.
    • Provide advice and support to Business Units on how to maximise the utilisation of space in the flexible environment. Provide support to People Leaders and Accommodation Champions to encourage adherence to flexible working principles.
    • Ensure key business contacts are aware of workplace protocols and behaviours that support the flexible environment and know where they can obtain information and provide feedback
    • Provide ongoing support, guidance and training to Accommodation Champions for the Wayfinder Portal
    • Walk the floors of assigned building/s regularly to observe environment and engage with staff to support and reinforce workplace protocols and behaviours
    • Contribute to development of new or improved workplace management operating processes to support the flexible environment as a result of site observations and business unit feedback
    • Ensure Service requests are logged and updated accordingly in Wayfinder as business needs arise and complete evaluation survey of business for Service Requests when necessary
    • Attend PCC Meetings and other meetings chaired by Workplace Management team, contribute learnings and provide feedback on improving operating procedures
    • Influence completion of Wayfinder Portal confirmation on a monthly basis, follow-up on all un-confirmed Portal team, escalate where necessary.
    • Ensure all Wayfinder Teams have Accommodation Champions, identify to Property Partners where none can be identified

    Required Qualifications & Technical Skills
    • Strong internal relationship management, influencing and negotiating skills
    • Sound knowledge and understanding of working in a large office environment for a large dynamic organisation
    • Facilitating and presenting concepts
    • Demonstrated ability to work autonomously and work as part of a specialised professional team
    • Ability to challenge in a constructive manner
    • Computing including MS Office products, and experience with property/space management software.
    • Experience in accommodation and churn management and strategy or Building Services essential
    Cushman & Wakefield is a large, global organization that cares about its people. If you are keen to work in a professional, energetic, and motivated business that takes pride in giving employees the opportunities to learn and advance their careers, then we would like to hear from you.

    As an Equal Opportunity Employer, Cushman & Wakefield encourages indigenous Australian and female candidates to apply.

    Cushman & Wakefield provides equal employment opportunity. Discrimination of any type will not be tolerated. Cushman & Wakefield is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment withoutregard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by state, federal, or local law.

    Seniority Level

    Mid-Senior level

    Industry

    • Commercial Real Estate
    • Real Estate
    • Facilities Services

    Employment Type

    Full-time

    Job Functions

    • Consulting
    • Information Technology
    • Sales

856343406:
[

Audit Senior / Assistant Manager

Company Name RSM Australia Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 5 hours ago Number of views 16 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Melbourne CBD Location
  • National Professional Services Firm
  • Career Development Opportunities
About Us

RSM is the 6th largest network of independent audit, tax and consulting firms, encompassing over 120 countries, 800 offices and more than 43,000 people internationally. We have 30 offices throughout Australia and offer personalised services with in-depth expertise and resources in the accountancy, business consulting and risk management areas.

The Opportunity

Due to growth, our Melbourne Risk Advisory division is currently seeking an experienced and enthusiastic Audit Senior or Assistant Manager to join their friendly and supportive team. This position would suit a motivated individual with proven experience in internal audit.

Key Responsibilities Of The Role Include
  • Conducting various audit and assurance engagements simultaneously with numerous engagement team members per audit, including assisting with planning, execution and scheduling staff;
  • Assist in the planning of client deliverables (i.e. strategic internal audit plan, scope documents);
  • Responsible for the execution of fieldwork and documentation of work papers and findings (i.e. maintain the audit file);
  • Identifying and referriong ethical, accounting and conflict issues to manager and/or partner;
  • Summarising the key areas of the engagement for the partner;
  • Identification of findings and issues, and assisting in the drafting of client reports;
  • Assist in business development activities of the firm;
  • Coordination with other divisions;
  • Address technical issues and assist in preparing technical position papers;
  • Undertaking development of team members; and
  • Assisting with management and co-ordination of the audit team including training, mentoring and methodology compliance.
The Successful Applicant
To be considered for this role you must be able to demonstrate the following:
  • Qualified as a Chartered Accountant or near completion;
  • Business / Commerce degree;
  • 2-5 years professional practice experience;
  • IT audit capability or experience (desirable);
  • Well-developed organisational and time management skills;
  • Ability to build rapport with a variety of clients and colleagues;
  • Outstanding communication (verbal and written) skills, including report writing skills
  • Strong attention to detail;
  • Problem solving and decision making skills;
  • Advanced computer skills using Microsoft Products;
  • Working knowledge and application of Australian Audit and Assurance Standards and other applicable legislation; and
  • Flexibility to operate across a wide variety of clients and industries, and to quickly grasp new concepts.

What's On Offer

In this role you will be working within a national Firm and be mentored by experienced Internal Audit practitioners. You will have direct access to and work closely with the Partners and a wide variety of clients and assignments.

RSM provides our employees with the opportunity to connect for success through our culture, employee benefits and an environment that supports work life balance. On offer is a competitive opportunity for personal and professional development and a friendly and supportive environment.

If you're ready for your next career challenge then apply today for this great opportunity.

Industry

  • Accounting

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Accounting/Auditing
  • Finance

We have a fantastic opportunity for a passionate, results driven Project Sales Manager with proven experience in land sales to be the face of our Savana project, a master planned community in Melbourne’s Western growth corridor. Working 5 days per week (including Sat/Sun), you will report to the GM Marketing & Sales and GM Victoria and will be accountable for:

  • Achieving/exceeding sales revenue targets;

You must have a proven track record of success in residential land sales. You will present professionally with excellent communication skills and be passionate about delivering exceptional customer experience and building community. Your ability to build effective relationships with key stakeholders is key and you will thrive working in a fast-paced environment.

856130256:
[

Vendor Replenishment Planner

Company Name Lion Company Location Docklands, Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 8 hours ago Number of views 15 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


In an industry so competitive, we stand out by being different. By encouraging our teams to think differently, we're finding new ways to make a genuine connection with our customers.

We have an opportunity for a Vendor Replenishment Planner (VRP) to join the Lion Dairy & Drinks Integrated Business Planning (IBP) team based in our Docklands office.

You will be part of a team that provides the pivotal link between Coles and Lion's Integrated Business Planning teams and will monitor and manage stock levels and replenishment of Lion's Dairy products to all Coles Distribution Centre's (DC's) whilst providing Coles with exceptional service.

This fast paced role will see you as the conduit between Coles and a number of Lion internal stakeholders such as Logistics, Demand/ Supply Planning, & Sales to ensure we get our forecasting, ordering and delivery right to Coles every time. Solid relationship management and hitting our KPI's are key as you will be the Lion point of contact for the customer when challenges arise.

To be successful in the role, you will be calm under pressure and effectively able to problem solve and communicate. Strong analytical skills are essential, coupled with intermediate to advanced knowledge of MS Excel. The ideal candidate would have a well-developed knowledge of supply chain planning, inventory management, replenishment, and experience working with a diverse group of stakeholders. In addition, you thrive in a collaborative team culture where you are encouraged to develop and grow your career in a customer centric environment.

Hours of work will typically be from 7am-3.30pm and you will be onsite at Coles Head Office Tooronga once a fortnight.

Knowing you're connected to our purpose is important to us. Connecting to our customers isn't meaningful unless it's genuine and with this in mind, we invest in building and nurturing customer relationships that last a lifetime. Applications will close Tuesday 10th July, 2018.

Empower yourself to be part of this purpose - start a conversation with us today.

Seniority Level

Mid-Senior level

Industry

  • Consumer Goods
  • Food & Beverages

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Product Management
  • Strategy/Planning
  • Supply Chain
